intro: Phlegmariurus polydactylus, commonly known as the many-fingered clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, clustered stems and small, scale-like leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as strobili, are cone-like and contain spores for propagation. Phlegmariurus polydactylus plays an important role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
